messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] I KNOW NOW I GOT FAKES
messages.msgSnippet: Sorry that you and your friend got taken in on these.  They are just generic fakes.  They are not a copy of any particular sword.  They are just sort of
messages.messageBody:
Sorry that you and your friend got taken in on these. They are just
generic fakes. They are not a copy of any particular sword. They are
just sort of Japanese sword shaped, and then marketed as genuine to the
unwary. If you type in "Viking sword" on EBay, you will see lots of
modern swords that sort of look like Viking swords, but hopefully are
described as being reproductions somewhere in the description. I doubt
if any of them is a particularly good representation of the genuine
article, either.

Bob

messages.subject: I KNOW NOW I GOT FAKES
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you for the information, I know now I am getting fakes. I did pay a nice sum for the shipping and insurance, and I will be breaking contact with my
messages.messageBody:
Thank you for the information, I know now I am getting fakes. I did
pay a nice sum for the shipping and insurance, and I will be
breaking contact with my "friend." But he was probably taken as
well, for he bought 13-14 swords at antique stores in Shang Hai. So
mabe it wasn't really his fault.
As far as my fakes I posted pictures of them in a photo album here.
Maybe someone can tell me of what they are fakes of? I didn't get
them for their collecting value, but for demonstrative use. I'd
still like to know a little about them. and maybe in the future
after I've learned more, buy a real one.
Ran
